snippet: The government hopes to avoid the large and increasingly violent environmental protests of the last year, which halted several industrial projects.
abstract: Chinese government orders that all major industrial projects must pass 'social risk assessment' before they begin; move is aimed at curtailing large and increasingly violent environmental protests of the past year, which have forced suspension or cancellation of chemical plants, coal-fired power plants and giant copper smelter.
lead_paragraph: The government hopes to avoid the large and increasingly violent environmental protests of the last year, which halted several industrial projects.

headline.seo: China Mandates ‘Social Risk’ Reviews for Big Projects
headline.main: ‘Social Risk’ Test Ordered by China for Big Projects
headline.print_headline: ‘Social Risk’ Test Ordered By China for Big Projects
